RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 15, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOO BAD JUSTICE contested a pressured pace through the backstretch and kept the edge at the rail rounding the turn, dueled clear past the eighth pole and held on well with steady handling. HINK'S PALADIN pressured the pace and contested at a slim disadvantage two deep on the turn, relented in the stretch duel for second but held on for second. BE BE BOP gave chase, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. E J'S REVENGE veered out leaving the gate then gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and flattened in the lane. JIMMY THE KID gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. CHARITABLY GIFTED chased, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened in the stretch. BALI'S SHADE gave chase and rounded the turn about the five path. PRIMETIME JET broke a step slow and saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Charitably Gifted
ENTRY.OWNER: Shepherd Robert Phillips Jason and Harrison Glenn N

ENTRY.NAME: Too Bad Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pressured pace,edge rail turn,clear past 1/8,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 15, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: URKILLINGMEBETH saved ground the opening turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and closed steadily, was eased to the five path through the far turn, dug in from the head of the lane and took the lead in the final yards. GOLD TIME VIXEN stalked from the three path the first turn and raced at even terms past the half mile pole, dueled from the seven sixteenths, took the nod two deep midway on the far turn and dug in under steady stretch handling, but was caught in the final yards. JAMESTOWN ROAD stalked two deep, moved to even terms past the half mile pole and had the nod leaving the seven sixteenths, but was met at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened inside the sixteenth pole. SO RED THE ROSE rounded the first turn in the three path, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. MISS WILD rated the early pace inside, was met leaving the half mile pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back at the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met past 1/2,chased,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Jamestown Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,even terms past 1/2,led past 7/16,met mid turn,weaken

ENTRY.NAME: Urkillingmebeth
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 3/8,5p far turn,steadily closed,up late yds

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Time Vixen
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,even terms past 1/2,dueled,nod mid turn,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 15, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOX RED tapered in and raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead nearing the half mile pole and raced clear leaving the three eighths, widened at the rail on the far turn, was kept alert to mid-stretch then taken in hand later yards. NO FOOLING DUDE rated off the pace inside, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and cleared second past the eighth pole. LUCKYTOBEINAMERICA settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn, left the turn outside and came along to take third later yards. ELEVATED FOREVER saved ground on the opening turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn then flattened in the lane. FLAT CAT settled off the rail the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the stretch. ENVISION SUCCESS broke in the air and was not a factor. JAZZ MAN DO raced with the pace inside, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. MACY'S BOY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,clear 2nd past 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz Man Do
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,chased past 1/2,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Elevated Forever
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased past 7/16,4p far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Fox Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,up near 1/2,dueled clear 3/8,widened,in hand late

ENTRY.NAME: Luckytobeinamerica
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,5p far turn,along 3rd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEE MOUNTAIN angled to the inside and rated the early pace, came under pressure at the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled to hold on. STORMIN' ANNA gave chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail then dueled through the stretch and just lasted for second. MAKAAN chased, rounded the turn off the rail and just missed in the stretch duel for second. SOMEBODY LOVES ME gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and passed some rivals in an even finish. ZIDORMI chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. PURPLE CALLA hesitated at the break, gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. KIMSFAVORITESTORM gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and weakened in the lane. LAZY ACES saved ground. TIZZ THE G chased outside and rounded the turn about the six path. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Bee Mountain for alleged interference shortly after the start, lodged by the rider of Stormin' Anna.

ENTRY.NAME: Bee Mountain
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,rated pace,pressured 1/4,rail turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 15, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allo wed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONTAUK DADDY gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, took the nod passing the eighth pole and was hand urged to draw away later yards. STEVETHEVANDRIVER set a pressured pace and contested the edge at the rail on the turn, was met past the eighth pole and flattened stride later yards. DRINKWITHTHESTARS tapered in and pressured the pace, raced close off the rail on the turn then dug in through the stretch and held on for third. DANCIN IN DUBAI gave chase, rounded the turn about the six path and passed some rivals widest. GRAND FIBER gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the six path on the turn and passed some rivals. MAGICAL EXPRESS chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. HE IS BONAFIDE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. HEY CONGRATS came away a bit rank then gave chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened the final sixteenth. SO COURAGEOUS chased outside, rounded the turn in the five path, showed no response leaving the turn, was pulled up lame then vanned off post race.

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew

ENTRY.NAME: Magical Express
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus Joy Kevin J and McMahon Michael H

ENTRY.NAME: Stevethevandriver
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,met past 1/8,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Montauk Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4p turn,nod past 1/8,drew away late,hand ridden

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jennifer A. Johnson & Gillian K. Johnson

ENTRY.NAME: So Courageous
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,5p turn,no response,pulled up lame,vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Drinkwiththestars
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,off rail turn,dug in lane,held on 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YES TO LOVE accelerated to the lead at the three eighths pole and rated the pace, was urged clear at the rail leaving the quarter pole then kept sharp through the lane. SYMPTOMATIC gave chase, raced in the six path on the turn, drifted wider entering the stretch and dug in to take second inside the sixteenth pole. GHOSTLY ANNA took a brief slim lead leaving the seven sixteenths pole then gave chase, dropped back at the quarter, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. BUTTERFLY WORLD gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. SING ME TO SLEEP chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. FRIEND FURH REAL chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. SHOTGUN MARGARET gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. SPECIAL KAYLEE had a brief early lead then gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the turn in the three and four paths then weakened in the lane. QUEEN SABINE broke rank and in the air then saved ground. Unite The Girls ran loose in the post parade and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Butterfly World
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Yes to Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 3/8,rated pace,urged clear 1/4,rail turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 15 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 15 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 OrL ess Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CREOLE took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and rated the pace inside, pulled herself away through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the stretch. PLANET FROLIC stalked from the three path the opening turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and settled for second best. SKY BUY settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then dueled through the final sixteenth for third. KILMALEY rated close in the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and relented third later yards. TRAVEL SMART was roughed off the heels of rivals into the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and weakened. UNCONSCIOUS MIND stalked the early pace off the rail, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. LA CORONA broke through the gate prior the start, had a brief early lead inside and saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: La Corona
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke through prior,brief lead inside,saved ground

ENTRY.NAME: Creole
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/4,rated pace,pulled away backstretch,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Unconscious Mind
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,weakened off rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PAPA LINGUINE settled well back toward the inside on the first turn, eased out with a bid into the backstretch and steadily progressed, raced in the three path on the far turn, dug in for the lead late stretch and drew away nearing the wire. SHOOT THE BREEZE stalked from the four path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the lead leaving the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in under steady handling; relented late yards and just lasted for second. LOVE IS WICKED saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and finished well to take third the final yards. OUTLAW BILLY stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and contested at a close disadvantage off the rail on the far turn, but dropped back mid-stretch and flattened later yards. SEABROOK ISLAND rated close off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened mid-stretch. VALHALLA'S PALACE took over at the rail into the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met passing the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn. DANTE'S INFERNO raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. RUDD'S ROCKET bobbled at the break, raced in the three path the opening turn and proved no factor. SEATTLE PRINCE bobbled leaving the gate then stalked two deep the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. SAN SEBASTIAN came away awkwardly, raced in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Love Is Wicked
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,4p far turn,up 3rd late,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Papa Linguine
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,eased out,chased 1/2,3p far turn,up late,cleared

ENTRY.NAME: San Sebastian
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Steinmann Eric

ENTRY.NAME: Valhalla's Palace
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met past 5/16,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Outlaw Billy
ENTRY.OWNER: McCartney Sr Shannon W and Casey Shannon E
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,chased 7/16,close off rail turn,flattened late yards
